p: Under HT treatment, we found that there was a significant decrease reduction of 42.2% in net photosynthetic rate (P n) values of S. calendulacea ( p < 0.05). However, no significant differences were observed in the P n values of S. trilobata ( Figure 2A). The photosynthetic efficiency of plants is closely related to the electron transfer of chloroplasts. With respect to the control treatment, we found that S. calendulacea and S. trilobata showed decreases in maximum photochemical efficiency of PSII (F v/F m) of 48.5% and 1.4% under HT treatment, respectively ( Figure 2B). We also observed that the operational photochemical efficiency (Î¦ PSII) increased in S. trilobata but was significantly inhibited in S. calendulaceas with a decrease range of 24.6% during the exposure to high temperature ( Figure 2C).
